p: Culex quinefasciatus egg rafts were collected from stagnant water in the Al kadarow area. The egg rafts were kept in an aluminum dish with 10.6 inches width and 1.6 inches depth containing distilled water till hatching, and the larvae were fed with fine powdered bread. Dead larvae were continuously removed to a void contamination of cultures with pathogens. The third instars larvae for experiments were used.
